items.title: Pinegrove Opportunity Raises $2.2 Billion for New Venture Secondaries Fund
items.summary: Pinegrove Opportunity Partners has raised $2.2 billion for its debut fund, closing a large investment round in a fast-growing niche of the venture capital market.

items.title: Ex-Goldman Banker Who Pleaded Guilty in 1MDB Fraud Seeks Pardon
items.summary: Tim Leissner, the former Goldman Sachs Group Inc. banker who admitted his role in one of the largest financial frauds in history, is seeking a presidential pardon before he surrenders to a federal prison.

items.title: More gets ₹607 cr from promoters ahead of IPO
items.summary: Amazon and Samara Capital have injected ₹607 crore into More Retail this fiscal year, ahead of a planned IPO. The supermarket chain aims to use these funds for debt reduction and business expansion. More Retail has halved its net losses and seen sales growth, transitioning to a hybrid online-offline model to drive profitable expansion.

items.title: Credit flows to commercial sector increase 15% in 2025
items.summary: Non-banking finance companies (NBFCs) saw their lending grow by 22% in the period leading up to the end of December. This expansion was faster than that of bank advances, which reported a 14.4% growth during the same timeframe. NBFCs, excluding bank credit to these companies, had outstanding loans totaling Rs 35.8 lakh crore.

items.title: Trump tariffs reshaping global trade, say experts
items.summary: Global trade is changing rapidly. US tariff policies have shifted focus from multilateral agreements to bilateral trade deals. This creates uncertainty for businesses. India is strategically diversifying its trade partnerships. This approach helps navigate a more disrupted world. New strategies are needed to adapt to these evolving trade dynamics.

items.title: Fly91 targets operating break-even next fiscal
items.summary: Regional airline Fly91 aims for operating break-even in the next financial year, despite reporting a net loss of ₹67.6 crore in FY25. The carrier plans to achieve this by expanding its fleet to nine aircraft, increasing aircraft utilization, and adding new regional routes to its network.

items.title: New drugs could reach market sooner as govt halves trial review timeline
items.summary: The Indian government is shaking up the pharmaceutical sector by slashing the review period for manufacturing applications for new drugs to 45 days. Now, manufacturers can initiate clinical trials or bioequivalence studies with just a prior notification to the regulators, ditching the old requirement for express permission.

items.title: Government asks airlines to submit requests for IndiGo’s vacated slots
items.summary: Following massive disruptions, DGCA reduced IndiGo's winter schedule by 10%, which meant the airline had stopped operating services in various slots

items.title: World spent 33 times more on destroying nature than on protecting it: UN Report
items.summary: Global spending on nature protection lags far behind nature destruction.  While $220 billion was spent to protect nature in 2023, $7.3 trillion was spent on its destruction.  The private sector drives this harmful spending.  To meet global commitments, investments in nature-based solutions must triple by 2030.

items.title: Crowds, security, rush hours—Can a robot handle it all? Meet ASC ARJUN
items.summary: ASC ARJUN is a humanoid robot designed to help RPF staff in many railway operations. It will support security, passenger help, crowd control, cleanliness checks, and safety awareness at the station.

items.title: European Stocks Rise as Trump Pivot Lifts Trade-Linked Sectors
items.summary: European stocks advanced for the first time in five days as President Donald Trump abandoned his threat to impose new Greenland-linked tariffs, while a slate of upbeat corporate earnings also lifted sentiment.

items.title: Budget 2026: Structured dispute resolution tops tax reform wishlist
items.summary: Businesses are urging the government to prioritise tax reforms in the upcoming budget. Key demands include quicker resolution of tax disputes and improved certainty in transfer pricing. Streamlining customs procedures and liberalising schemes like MOOWR are also crucial.

items.title: Bombay HC grants interim stay on Rs 57.29-crore GST demand on Mad Over Donuts
items.summary: The Directorate General of Goods and Services Tax Intelligence (DGGI), in a show-cause notice, held that over-the-counter sale of donuts could not be treated as a restaurant service and so would face 18% GST, not 5% that the company was paying.

items.title: Indian Oil lines up Rs 1 lakh crore for 18 GW green energy bet
items.summary: Indian Oil Corporation is set to invest approximately one lakh crore rupees. The company aims to acquire and build 18 gigawatts of green energy capacity by the year 2030.  Its renewable energy subsidiary, Terra Clean Ltd, is slated for a public listing by 2027-28.

items.title: Power transmission capacity hits 5 lakh circuit km; transformation capacity at 1,407 GVA
items.summary: India's power transmission network has reached a significant milestone, exceeding five lakh circuit kilometres and 1,407 GVA transformation capacity. A new 765 kV line in Rajasthan has been commissioned, boosting renewable energy evacuation. Transmission lines and transformation capacity have seen substantial growth since 2014. Future projects will further strengthen the grid and support the nation's renewable energy goals.

items.title: EU suspends export benefits for certain Indian goods ahead of key FTA conclusion
items.summary: The European Union has suspended export benefits for a significant portion of Indian goods, including textiles and metals, effective January 1. This move removes an average 20% tariff advantage, impacting India's price competitiveness against countries like Bangladesh and Vietnam. The suspension aligns with the EU's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism and occurs as FTA talks are nearing conclusion.

items.title: Unspent funds of up to ₹75,000 crore may help Centre meet FY26 fiscal deficit target
items.summary: The Indian government is poised to save ₹70,000-₹75,000 crore this fiscal year as several key ministries and welfare schemes underutilize their allocated funds. This significant saving will provide crucial fiscal headroom, enabling the government to manage increased subsidy outgo and potential shortfalls in tax receipts while aiming to meet its fiscal deficit target.

items.title: Over 10,000 km of roads sanctioned under Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana-IV: Govt
items.summary: Over 10,000 km of road projects have been sanctioned for six states under PMGSY-IV, promising connectivity to 3,270 isolated habitations. This initiative aims to unlock opportunities, foster inclusive growth, and solidify the foundation for a developed India by bridging gaps in healthcare, education, and livelihoods.

items.title: India’s Power Transmission network scales past 5 lakh circuit kilometres: Power Ministry
items.summary: According to the Power Ministry, India’s transmission network has grown by 71.6% since April 2014.

items.title: Bastar's first super-specialty hospital opens
items.summary: Bastar region will soon have its first super specialty hospital. Located in Jagdalpur, the facility opens in February. Hyderabad-based Continental Hospitals partners with the Chhattisgarh government. This 240-bedded hospital will offer advanced medical services.

items.title: Exporters’ budget wishlist: tax sops, inverted duty structure correction, and more
items.summary: Exporters are urging the government to implement tax incentives and rationalize import duties in the upcoming Budget. Key demands include reduced income tax for MSMEs, reinstatement of customs duty exemptions on certain leathers, and correction of inverted duty structures in sectors like synthetic yarns and electronics to boost domestic manufacturing and export competitiveness.
